最近睇緊John Berger 的 Understanding a Photograph
其中有個chapter "Stories"
文中提出一個問題
究竟照片係以怎樣的形式敘事?

"One can lie on the ground
and look up at the almost infinite number of stars in the night sky,
but in order to tell stories about those stars
they need to be seen as constellations,
the invisible lines which can connect them need to be assumed.

No story is like a wheeled vehicle
whose contact with the road is continuous.
Stories walk, like animals or men.
And their steps are not only between narrated events
but between each sentence,
sometimes each word.
Every step is a stride over something not said."

「想像有個人躺於地上
仰望夜空中的星羅萬象。
但若要講關於星宿的故事
就要以星座的角度細看
將星體連成的無形之線亦需由我地的想像填補。

故事並非如有轆的車輛
能在路上不斷轉動，
相反故事如動物或人類般行走
並且步伐不止跨過要敘述的事件之間
而係敘事的每一字、每一句。
每一步都係向留白的地方進發」

個人覺得呢段文字精闢描述好的相片
應該有哪樣的特質
(當然並唔係話所有相都要咁做)
亦好適用於紀實式攝影
有時影相
除左覺得個一刻好吸引就按下快門
反而留意下成個構圖內
不同部分之間的互動
利用相片中的內容引導viewers
從而理解故事
甚至思考相片以外的事物

本書睇暫時睇到一半
希望睇完之後有時間再開post講多少少

留名支持~

我理想嘅相片 除了第一眼睇嘅時候有視覺嘅衝擊 或 吸引力之外 (即是霎眼嬌)，仲有令 觀眾 留有印象，想主動去了解相片背後和以外嘅故事。

相片加上匹配嘅 名字和簡單嘅描述，展述 攝影師嘅想法，引導觀眾去理解。

睇到最後幾個chapter
中間嘅 Use of Photography, Appearances 同 Stories都比較深刻
另外有一節講 Eugene Smith 嘅作品分析
都對佢有深一層嘅理解
分享其中一段:
"The figure of the victim, suffering or dead,
is, by its nature, horizontal.
The figure of the healer or the mourner is vertical.
The two form a kind of cross
and this is where we can notice a simple but quite surprising fact.
...
But again and again
we find the same emotional theme
of the horizontal sufferer being nursed or mourned or held by somebody,
vertical, and moved by pity."

呢個chapter 可能之後再開post 詳講

又有一段講「畫」同「照片」嘅分別
"A drawing is a translation.
That is to say
each mark on the paper is consciously related,
not only to the real or imagined 'model',
but also to every mark and space already set out on the paper.
Thus a drawn or painted image is woven together by the energy
(or the lassitude(困倦), when the drawing is weak) of countless judgements.
Every time a figuration is evoked in a drawing,
everything about it has been mediated by consciousness,
either intuitively or systematically.
In a drawing an apple is made around and spherical;
in a photograph, the roundness and the light and shade of the apple are received as a given."

仲有其它好幾段都幾有趣
